website_summaries.verdict: A great cordless drill designed for tough-to-reach spaces.
pros: Built-in LED light makes it easy to use the drill in dark areas
Star Protection Computer Controls protect the drill against overheating and overloading
cons: Drill chuck sometimes won't stay tight

customer_reviews.title: VERY powerful
customer_reviews.text: This drill is amazing. Much more powerful than I ever would have imagined. I'm an electrician, and needed a drill for tight spaces. This thing drills a 1" Bosch Daredevil bit with no problem at all. Super fast, easy to grip, plenty of power, big win all around. Very impressive
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Watch your fingers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Drill has plenty of power for spade bits. Cuts through 2x4 with a sharp 5/8 spade bit like butter. I had to take two stars off because the keyless chuck is designed in such a way that the there is just enough room to have your finger pulled between the chuck and the body of the drill. I love Makita and have many LXT tools but this is a dangerous design. Do not use the drill to open and close the keyless chuck or it will grab your finger.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Burnt Up In First Few Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I didn’t get far with this Makita. It burnt up and sparks flew while drilling through a 2x4 with a brand new Bosch Nail Strike bit. This is a lighter duty tool. Needs a speed adjustment to force it into lower rpm if needed. Chuck was awkward to adjust with possibility of finger pinching. Overall this tool needs a redesign. Seems to be from the same blood as the older generation of Makita tools and is not a serious job site tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bolt of Rust

customer_reviews.title: A really nice right-angle drill - but a little large and heavy to maneuver in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: This drill has tons of torque and very good control over the drill speed. The keyless chuck grips tightly and makes it easy to change drill bits. The battery is somewhat large (although small for its power capacity) which sometimes can make it awkward to maneuver in very tight quarters. The screw-in side handle helps with control, but here again, can get in the way in tight quarters. Overall, though, I'm very happy with the drill. It has done what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberguy

customer_reviews.title: Love my Makita Cordless Tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cordless angle drill to scrub the hard water stains off my glass shower doors which took the place of using my hand and arms and it was so easy with great results. I also use it on my car where the big polisher can’t reach. I love my Makita Cordless Tools.

product_meta.title: Makita XAD02Z 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless 3/8" Angle Drill, Tool Only
product_meta.description: Style:Bare ToolThe Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless 3/8" Angle Drill (model XAD02Z, tool only) delivers cordless drilling power into tough-to-reach spaces. The versatile XAD02Z packs plenty of torque for a wide range of drilling and driving tasks, yet it weighs only 4.0 lbs. with a slim design and over one foot of tool extension. The 3/8" keyless chuck provides fast and easy bit removal. It's ideal for assembly, garage door installation, steel framing, woodworking, electrical, and any other job that requires a more compact drilling solution in close-quarters applications.
feature_bullets: Makita-built 4-pole motor delivers 121 in.lbs. of Max Torque
Variable speed (0-1,800 RPM) for a wide range of drilling and driving applications
3/8" keyless chuck for fast and easy bit installation and removal
Compact 3-1/2" angle head height for use in close quarters
Compact and ergonomic design at only 12-3/8" long
